title: Four Fish - tone of the passage

content.prompt: Which of the following best describes the tone of the passage?

choices.label: It is largely objective and rises in urgency.
It is marked by a growing sense of anger and disillusionment.
It alternates between quizzical disbelief and grave condemnation.
It shifts from mild concern to a final sense of optimism.

skill.text: Skill 7.A: Explain how word choice, comparisons, and syntax contribute to the specific tone or style of a text.
